verses.kjv: Then went Samson to Gaza, and saw there an harlot, and went in unto her.
verses.ct: Samson traveled to Gaza, where he noticed a prostitute and had relations with her.

verses.kjv: And it was told the Gazites, saying, Samson is come hither. And they compassed him in, and laid wait for him all night in the gate of the city, and were quiet all the night, saying, In the morning, when it is day, we shall kill him.
verses.ct: The people of Gaza were told, "Samson has come here." So they surrounded the area and waited for him all night at the city gate. They stayed quiet through the night, saying, "When morning comes, we'll kill him."

verses.kjv: And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and took the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and went away with them, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of an hill that is before Hebron.
verses.ct: But Samson only stayed until midnight. He got up in the middle of the night, grabbed the doors of the city gate along with both posts, and pulled them out of the ground — bar and all. He hoisted them onto his shoulders and carried them to the top of the hill that faces Hebron.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
verses.ct: Some time later, he fell in love with a woman named Delilah who lived in the Valley of Sorek.

verses.kjv: And the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and said unto her, Entice him, and see wherein his great strength lieth, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him: and we will give thee every one of us eleven hundred pieces of silver.
verses.ct: The Philistine rulers went to her and said, "Seduce him and find out where his incredible strength comes from and how we can overpower him. We want to tie him up and subdue him. Each one of us will pay you 1,100 pieces of silver."

verses.kjv: And Delilah said to Samson, Tell me, I pray thee, wherein thy great strength lieth, and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict thee.
verses.ct: So Delilah said to Samson, "Please tell me — where does your incredible strength come from? How could someone tie you up and subdue you?"

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green withs that were never dried, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
verses.ct: Samson told her, "If someone ties me up with 7 fresh bowstrings that haven't been dried out, I'll lose my strength and become just like any ordinary man."

verses.kjv: Then the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven green withs which had not been dried, and she bound him with them.
verses.ct: So the Philistine rulers brought her 7 fresh bowstrings that hadn't been dried, and she tied him up with them.

verses.kjv: Now there were men lying in wait, abiding with her in the chamber. And she said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he brake the withs, as a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the fire. So his strength was not known.
verses.ct: She had men hiding in the room, waiting to ambush him. Then she shouted, "Samson, the Philistines are here!" But he snapped the bowstrings like a piece of string that touches a flame. So the secret of his strength remained unknown.

verses.kjv: And Delilah said unto Samson, Behold, thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: now tell me, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be bound.
verses.ct: Delilah said to Samson, "You've been making a fool of me and telling me lies! Now please, tell me the real way you could be tied up."

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, If they bind me fast with new ropes that never were occupied, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
verses.ct: He told her, "If someone ties me tightly with brand-new ropes that have never been used, I'll lose my strength and become just like any ordinary man."

verses.kjv: Delilah therefore took new ropes, and bound him therewith, and said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And there were liers in wait abiding in the chamber. And he brake them from off his arms like a thread.
verses.ct: So Delilah got new ropes and tied him up with them. Then she shouted, "Samson, the Philistines are here!" Men were hiding in the room, ready to ambush him. But he tore the ropes off his arms as easily as snapping a thread.

verses.kjv: And Delilah said unto Samson, Hitherto thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound. And he said unto her, If thou weavest the seven locks of my head with the web.
verses.ct: Delilah said to Samson, "You keep making a fool of me and telling me lies! Tell me how you could really be tied up." He replied, "If you weave the 7 braids of my hair into the fabric on a loom."

verses.kjv: And she fastened it with the pin, and said unto him, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he awaked out of his sleep, and went away with the pin of the beam, and with the web.
verses.ct: So she pinned it tight with the loom pin and shouted, "Samson, the Philistines are here!" He woke up from his sleep and pulled away the loom pin along with the entire fabric.

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, How canst thou say, I love thee, when thine heart is not with me? thou hast mocked me these three times, and hast not told me wherein thy great strength lieth.
verses.ct: She said to him, "How can you claim to love me when you don't trust me with the truth? You've made a fool of me 3 times now and still haven't told me where your incredible strength comes from."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, so that his soul was vexed unto death;
verses.ct: Day after day she pressured him with her words and urged him until he was worn down to the point of exhaustion.

verses.kjv: That he told her all his heart, and said unto her, There hath not come a razor upon mine head; for I have been a Nazarite unto God from my mother’s womb: if I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man.
verses.ct: Finally, he revealed everything to her. He said, "A razor has never touched my head, because I've been set apart as a Nazirite dedicated to God since before I was born. If my head were shaved, my strength would leave me, and I'd become weak — just like any ordinary man."

verses.kjv: And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, Come up this once, for he hath shewed me all his heart. Then the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and brought money in their hand.
verses.ct: When Delilah realized he had revealed the whole truth to her, she sent a message to the Philistine rulers: "Come back one more time — he's told me everything." So the Philistine rulers came to her, bringing the silver payment with them.

verses.kjv: And she made him sleep upon her knees; and she called for a man, and she caused him to shave off the seven locks of his head; and she began to afflict him, and his strength went from him.
verses.ct: She lulled him to sleep on her lap, then called in a man to shave off the 7 braids from his head. She began to overpower him, and his strength drained away.

verses.kjv: And she said, The Philistines be upon thee, Samson. And he awoke out of his sleep, and said, I will go out as at other times before, and shake myself. And he wist not that the LORD was departed from him.
verses.ct: She shouted, "Samson, the Philistines are here!" He woke up and thought, "I'll break free just like I did before and shake them off." But he didn't realize that the LORD had left him.

verses.kjv: But the Philistines took him, and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza, and bound him with fetters of brass; and he did grind in the prison house.
verses.ct: The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes. They took him down to Gaza, bound him with bronze chains, and forced him to grind grain in the prison.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the hair of his head began to grow again after he was shaven.
verses.ct: However, the hair on his head began growing back after it had been shaved.

verses.kjv: Then the lords of the Philistines gathered them together for to offer a great sacrifice unto Dagon their god, and to rejoice: for they said, Our god hath delivered Samson our enemy into our hand.
verses.ct: The Philistine rulers gathered for a great celebration to offer a massive sacrifice to their god Dagon. They declared, "Our god has given us victory over Samson, our enemy!"

verses.kjv: And when the people saw him, they praised their god: for they said, Our god hath delivered into our hands our enemy, and the destroyer of our country, which slew many of us.
verses.ct: When the people saw Samson, they praised their god, saying, "Our god has handed over to us our enemy — the one who devastated our land and killed so many of us."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when their hearts were merry, that they said, Call for Samson, that he may make us sport. And they called for Samson out of the prison house; and he made them sport: and they set him between the pillars.
verses.ct: While they were in high spirits, they shouted, "Bring out Samson so he can entertain us!" So they brought Samson out of the prison, and he performed for them. Then they stood him between the main pillars of the building.

verses.kjv: And Samson said unto the lad that held him by the hand, Suffer me that I may feel the pillars whereupon the house standeth, that I may lean upon them.
verses.ct: Samson said to the young servant who was leading him by the hand, "Let me touch the pillars that hold up this building so I can lean against them."

verses.kjv: Now the house was full of men and women; and all the lords of the Philistines were there; and there were upon the roof about three thousand men and women, that beheld while Samson made sport.
verses.ct: The building was packed with men and women. All the Philistine rulers were there, and about 3,000 men and women were on the roof watching Samson perform.

verses.kjv: And Samson called unto the LORD, and said, O Lord God, remember me, I pray thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, only this once, O God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes.
verses.ct: Then Samson cried out to the LORD, "Lord GOD, please remember me. Please give me strength just this one last time, God, so I can pay back the Philistines for taking my 2 eyes."

verses.kjv: And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars upon which the house stood, and on which it was borne up, of the one with his right hand, and of the other with his left.
verses.ct: Samson placed his hands on the 2 central pillars that supported the building — his right hand on one and his left hand on the other.

verses.kjv: And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were therein. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than they which he slew in his life.
verses.ct: Samson said, "Let me die alongside the Philistines." Then he pushed with everything he had, and the building collapsed on the rulers and everyone inside. He killed more people in his death than he had during his entire life.

verses.kjv: Then his brethren and all the house of his father came down, and took him, and brought him up, and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the buryingplace of Manoah his father. And he judged Israel twenty years.
verses.ct: His brothers and his father's entire family came down, retrieved his body, and brought him back to bury him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of his father Manoah. He had led Israel for 20 years.
